attributes.action: add Sickle Cell Aneamia, Thalassemia and Lupus to the list of conditions deemed to be a disability at the point of diagnosis.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Uncounted numbers of people with Sickle Cell Aneamia,
    Thalassemia and Lupus are being disciminated against in
    employment and training in the UK . Misunderstood and labelled
    as lazy or lacking in commitment they are sacked or thrown off
    training courses. The struggle to get Disability Living
    Allowance or challenge discriminating employers is an
    additional hurdle that many sufferers cannot face. Many already
    live with NHS services who do not have the skills,knowledge or
    competencies to treat their conditions effectively.  All of these
    conditions require the focus of  national strategies, competency
    frameworks and performance indicators to quality assure the
    treatment they receive.  They also need to be recognised as
    having a disability from the point of diagnosis not after years
    of suffering.  Please lend your support to the 'Human Rights at Diagnosis' campaign.
